meanings.definition: Having less light, not as bright
meanings.sent1: The room grew darker as the sun set.
meanings.sent2: The night sky was darker than the day.
meanings.sent3: The flashlight made the dark room even darker!
meanings.sent4: Her mood grew darker as the argument escalated.
meanings.sent5: The shadow cast by the tree was even darker than the ground.

meanings.definition: More intense or serious in nature
meanings.sent1: The situation took a darker turn when the storm hit.
meanings.sent2: His expression grew darker as he listened to the news.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show unexpectedly took a darker tone.
meanings.sent4: The mystery novel's plot grew darker with each chapter.
meanings.sent5: The ominous clouds signaled a darker mood in the air.

meanings.definition: Of a lower color value, closer to black
meanings.sent1: The artist used a darker shade of blue for the painting.
meanings.sent2: The night sky appeared darker with each passing minute.
meanings.sent3: The black cat looked even darker against the white snow.
meanings.sent4: The shadows grew darker as the sun dipped below the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds loomed overhead, casting a darker hue over the landscape.
